explanation: Craig claims he was at dinner at Harborview Grill until 9:30 PM. But Clue 3 reveals the restaurant closes at 9 PM on Wednesdays — his dinner ended earlier than he claimed. Clue 2 shows Craig's own badge was used to enter the building at 9:40 PM, and the thermostat panel is just fifteen feet from the lobby entrance. Clue 1 confirms someone entered at 9:40 PM and left at 9:55 PM — a quick in-and-out trip, just long enough to crank the thermostat. Craig lied about his dinner timeline to hide his late-night visit to the office.
funFact: Thermostat wars are the number one source of passive-aggressive conflict in American offices, with studies showing men and women prefer temperatures that differ by an average of 5 degrees.
